etymology.description: Two men back to back; originally meaning “back” (now written 背).
etymology.interpretation: Two figures face away from each other, conveying the notion of turning one’s back. In traditional orientation where one faces south, the ‘back’ side corresponds to the north, so the graph shifted to denote the direction.

examples.chinese: 我们向北走(我們向北走)。
北京在中国的北部(北京在中國的北部)。
examples.english: Beijing is in the north of China.

examples.chinese: 冬天从北面吹来的风很冷(冬天從北面吹來的風很冷)。
examples.pinyin: Dōngtiān cóng běimiàn chuī lái de fēng hěn lěng.
examples.english: In winter, winds blowing from the north are very cold.
